required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Interleukin 4 and Interferon Gamma Predictors of Human Papillomavirus Immunotherapy in Warts
clinical_study.official_title: IL-4 and IFN-γ as Immunologic Predictors of Response to HPV Immunotherapy in Warts

brief_summary.textblock: In the present study the investigators assessed the invitro role of IL-4 and IFN-γ in predicting the response to bivalent HPV vaccine after whole blood stimulation

detailed_description.textblock: 40 Patients and 40 controls are enrolled in the study. Participants suffer from chronic recurrent cutaneous and genital warts. Blood samples were withdrawn then whole blood cultures are prepared. Cultures are stimulated with bivalent HPVvaccine. IL-4 and IFN-γ measurement in culture supernatants by ELISA. IL-4 and IFN-γ are investigated to predict the therapeutic response to bivalent HPV vaccine immunotherapy in warts.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of IFN-γ and IL-4 levels
primary_outcome.description: Quantitative measurement of IFN-γ and IL-4 in culture supernatants

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the size of warts
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical observation and photographing of wart size

arm_group.description: Patients having multiple recurrent and recalcitrant cutaneous and genital warts
Healthy volunteers matched for age and sex

intervention.description: Blood samples are withdrawn from participants and whole blood cultures are prepared and stimulated by bivalent HPV vaccine.IL-4 and IFN-γ are measured in culture supernatants

study_pop.textblock: Patients are attendants in Zagazig University Hospitals Dermatology outpatient clinic

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with recurrent and recalcitrant cutaneous and anogenital warts.
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of allergy to the HPV vaccine
- Active viral, fungal, or bacterial infections
- Immunosuppressive diseases or drugs.
- Autoimmune diseases, or other systemic diseases, e.g., hepatic, or renal disorders, diabetes, meningitis or convulsions
- Skin allergies
- Pregnancy and lactation
- Earlier wart treatment at least one month before enrollment.

overall_official.affiliation: Faculty of Medicine, Zagazig University , Zagazig, Egypt
